{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3482152,"name":"","username":"AvocadoPeel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/avocadopeel/{size}/232401_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T16:20:57.224Z","cooked":"

One of the changes for 2025 is discretize SimpleMotorFeedforward, and marking calculate(double velocity, double acceleration) deprecated.

What’s the reasoning behind this? And what’s the advantage to the suggested alternative, calculateWithVelocities() ?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T16:20:57.224Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":85.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":481667,"topic_slug":"simplemotorfeedforward-discretization","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/simplemotorfeedforward-discretization/481667/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3482191,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T16:46:04.452Z","cooked":"

The continuous-time version is only correct in the limit where the timestep goes to zero.

The discretized model properly calculates the constant voltage needed required to transition from the initial velocity to the next velocity over the timestep. The bigger the timestep, the more this will vary from the (now-deprecated) continuous-time equation.
